description: Students examine the artistic heritage of the German-speaking countries and develop the
skill of interpreting and analyzing art works in their cultural context. The specific
topic may vary and may be broadly or narrowly defined to include a specific art form,
theme, period, artist, or the art of the German-speaking countries. Topics include: the
arts in turn-of-the-century Vienna, the Bauhaus, Weimar cinema, and German Expressionism.
Taught in English. May be repeated if topic is different. Offered periodically.
